section.title: Mirroring &productname; repositories with &rmt;
section.para: Use this procedure to mirror the &productname; LTSS repositories for &rhel; &productnumber; and CentOS Linux &productnumber;.

listitem.para: The &rmt; server is installed and up to date.

The &rmt; server has enough storage available for repository mirroring. The amount of storage required depends on the number of repositories you mirror. We recommend at least 1.5 times the total size of all enabled repositories. Be aware that the &productname; repositories will grow substantially over time.
Your organization credentials appear correctly in /etc/rmt.conf.
You have a &productname; subscription activated in &scc;.

important.title: New repository structure for &productname; &productnumber; LTSS
important.para: The repository structure has changed in &productname; &productnumber; LTSS. The non-LTSS subscription had one default repository and one optional Source repository. The LTSS subscription has a default LTSS-Updates repository, an optional BASE-Updates repository, and optional Source and Debug repositories for both LTSS and BASE.
BASE repositories are frozen and contain the existing packages from the non-LTSS repositories. LTSS repositories contain new packages for &productname; &productnumber; LTSS.
Additionally, the optional &ha; repositories are now included in the &productname; &productnumber; LTSS product instead of a separate &ha; extension.
If you previously mirrored the &productname; repositories with the general subscription, clean up these repositories first before you start mirroring the new LTSS repositories:
